ai.summary: A demanding 26.5 km circuit named Beyond Hartham Common in the UK. The route combines urban paths, rural lanes, and wooded sections, delivering a hard day on the trail with varied surfaces and several elevation gains. Best suited to experienced hikers with solid navigation skills and a good pace.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of surfaced city pavements, grassy field edges, muddy woodland tracks, uneven forest paths, stiles and gates, and occasional exposed viewpoints. Ground conditions can be slick after rain; be prepared for uneven footing and potential boggy sections.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long, hard hike with changing weather and terrain. Check the forecast, daylight hours, and plan for 8–10 hours on trail. Carry a map and compass (and GPS as backup), stay on waymarked routes, and watch for traffic on rural sections. Hydrate, snack regularly, and carry a basic first aid kit. Let someone know your plan and expected return time. In cold or wet conditions, dress in layers and have waterproof outerwear and a warmth layer. Carry a whistle and a charged phone for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing (layers: base, insulating layer, waterproof outer layer)
Water for hydration (2–3 liters) and snacks
Map and compass (and GPS as backup)
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Spare socks and basic repair kit
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for the best daylight and drier conditions; winter hikes are possible but require extra precautions for ice, mud, and shorter days.

seo.title: Beyond Hartham Common – 26.5 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Take on Beyond Hartham Common: a 26.5 km hard hike through a mix of urban paths, rural lanes and woodlands in the UK. Tips on terrain, safety and gear.
